main event: A silver, spherical object was observed drifting with flashing lights for over one minute, evaluated as a probable balloon.
interesting points: The object was observed by several aircraft, including a Pan Am flight and a United Airlines flight, at altitudes ranging from 10,000 to 35,000 feet.
The object was described as a large, silver-colored balloon, with a diameter estimated to be between 20-30 feet.
The balloon appeared to be constructed of a thin, translucent silver-colored material and seemed to change shape with the wind.
The object was observed for over an hour, with multiple sightings reported from different locations and altitudes.
The Air Force evaluated the object as a probable balloon and did not consider it a threat.
